sentence.Network_en: The oak is implicit in the acorn.
The tree grew from a small acorn.

sentence.Network_cn: 为更清晰地理解此处的问题，我们来看一种不同的生物系统，比如说，橡子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  æcern, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch aker, also to acre,later associated with oak and corn

entry.def: An acorn is a pale oval nut that is the fruit of an oak tree.

means.word_mean: 1. fruit of the oak tree: a smooth thin-walled nut in a woody cup-shaped base

sentences.en: Acorns were good till bread was found.
Great oaks from little acorns grow.
Welcome to my new website!It may not look much at the moment, but great oaks from little acorns grow!
